intro: Chomelia ramiae, commonly known as the golden flame plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are pollinated primarily by birds and insects.
